title: Egg Tart
about: One of the most famous Chinese desserts is the classic egg tart, a delicious pastry consisting of a flaky outer shell with a creamy, but firm egg custard in the center. The origin of this traditional Chinese dessert is vague.
ingredients: 200 g cake flour (plus extra for dusting)
2 tablespoons beaten egg (from the custard filling eggs)
recipeInstructions:
For the pastry, in a large bowl, sift flour, sugar, and salt. Then add softened butter. Bring the mixture together with your hands, careful not to knead the pastry dough too much or you will make the pastry tough. 
 Whisk the egg yolks and add the 2 tablespoons of beaten yolk to the flour mixture. Bring together until smooth. If the dough is too sticky, coating your hands with flour will help. Cover with plastic wrap and then refrigerate for 30 minutes, or until the dough is firm. 
 To make the custard filling, melt sugar and salt with hot water. Mix until dissolved then let cool. 
 Add the rest of the beaten egg yolk. Stir in sugar water and also evaporated milk (if adding vanilla, add now). Stir and combine everything well. 
 Strain the filling to ensure no lumps. Chill in the refrigerator. 
 Preheat the oven to 400˚F (200˚C). 
 Take the dough out and divide into 16 equal portions. Spray the tart pan with a light coating of oil. Take one portion of your dough and roll it into a ball and place in your tart shell. Press the shell into the pan with your fingers. Try to make the wrapper uniform in thickness and avoid a thick bottom. Repeat to finish all. 
 Pour the custard filling into the shells until it is about 80% full. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes until the surface becomes golden brown and a toothpick can stand in the egg tart. 
 Cool down for several minutes and then take the egg tarts out of the pan. Serve while still warm.

title: Croissants
about: Croissants are a classic French pastry known for their buttery, flaky layers. Making croissants at home requires patience and technique but results in bakery-quality treats with a rich flavor and light texture.
ingredients: 4⅔ cups/605 grams all-purpose or bread flour, plus more for dusting
1 tablespoon plus ½ teaspoon/12 grams kosher salt
¾ cup plus 2 tablespoons/214 grams water, at room temperature
½ cup/120 grams whole milk, at room temperature
¼ cup/57 grams unsalted butter, cut into ½-inch pieces, chilled
For the Butter Block and Assembly:
1½ cups/340 grams unsalted European or European-style butter (3 sticks), chilled
recipeInstructions:
In a stand mixer, combine flour, sugar, salt, and yeast. Add water and milk, mixing to form a dough. Rest for 10 minutes. 
 Add butter to the dough, mixing until smooth and elastic, about 8-10 minutes. Let rise for 45 minutes to 1 hour, then refrigerate for at least 4 hours. 
Make the butter block by flattening cold butter into an 8-inch square between parchment paper. Chill until needed. 
Roll the dough into an 8-inch square. Freeze for 20 minutes. 
 Enclose the butter block in the dough, roll out to 24 inches long, and perform a double turn (book fold). Freeze for 15 minutes, then refrigerate for 1 hour. 
 Roll the dough again, perform a single turn (letter fold), freeze for 15 minutes, and refrigerate for 1 hour. 
Roll out to 14 by 17 inches, trim, and cut into triangles. Shape each triangle into a croissant. 
 Proof in a warm, humid environment for 2-2½ hours. 
Preheat the oven to 375°F. Brush croissants with egg wash, bake for 20 minutes, rotate sheets, then bake for an additional 10-15 minutes until deeply golden. Cool before serving.

title: Matcha Tiramisu
about: A twist on a classic tiramisu dessert with creamy matcha mascarpone cream and soft, spongey ladyfingers soaked in matcha for plenty of amazing green tea flavour.
recipeInstructions:
Matcha Mascarpone Cream: Fill a pot with about 1 inch of water and bring it to a boil. In a large mixing bowl that fits into the pot without touching the water, whisk together the egg yolks and granulated sugar. 
 When the water starts boiling, turn off the heat and place the bowl on top of the pot to create a double boiler. Continuously whisk the egg mixture until the sugar dissolves and it becomes pale in color, about 5 minutes. 
 Remove the bowl from the pot and immediately add in the softened mascarpone cheese. Whisk together until smooth and silky. Set aside. 
 In a separate mixing bowl, add the whipping cream, matcha powder, and vanilla extract. Use an electric hand mixer with a whisk attachment to whip the cream until it reaches medium peaks. It should have structure and leave trails but still be fluid and not completely stiff. 
 Add the whipped cream to the mascarpone mixture and fold together with a spatula until no streaks remain. Set aside. 
 Matcha Soak: In a shallow bowl, combine matcha powder, granulated sugar, and hot water. Use a matcha whisk, milk frother, or regular whisk to whisk until slightly frothy, about 30 seconds. 
 Very briefly dip a ladyfinger in the matcha soak just enough to coat both sides. Let any excess drip off. Do NOT let it sit in the liquid or soak all the way through or it will quickly turn into mush. Place the ladyfinger in the bottom of a serving container. Repeat until you have a flat, even layer of ladyfingers. 
 Add a generous layer of mascarpone cream on top of the ladyfingers and use a spatula to smooth it evenly. 
 Repeat with another layer of soaked ladyfingers and another layer of mascarpone cream. 
 Cover and chill your matcha tiramisu in the fridge for at least 4 hours or overnight to allow the cream to firm up and ladyfingers to soften. 
 Topping: Right before serving, sprinkle the top of your tiramisu with matcha powder.

title: Panna Cotta
about: Panna cotta is a traditional, easy, and delicious Italian custard. This homemade recipe tastes just like the panna cotta served at Italian restaurants. Serve with warm hot fudge sauce and fresh raspberries on top. It keeps well for several days in the refrigerator.
recipeInstructions:
Pour milk into a small bowl. Sprinkle gelatin powder over milk and stir until combined. Set aside. 
 In a saucepan, stir together heavy cream and sugar. Set over medium heat and bring to a boil, watching carefully as the cream can quickly bubble up. 
 Immediately stir in the gelatin mixture, stirring until completely dissolved. Cook and stir for 1 minute. 
 Remove the pan from heat and stir in vanilla extract. 
 Pour the cream mixture into 6 individual ramekins. Leave to cool, uncovered, for about 20 minutes until no longer warm. 
 Once cool, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until set, at least 4 hours or preferably overnight.

title: Homemade Brownies
about: These homemade brownies are rich, fudgy, and have a gooey texture reminiscent of a boxed mix but with all-natural ingredients. This recipe uses powdered sugar for a chewy consistency and a touch of cornstarch to thicken the batter.
ingredients: 1/2 cup canola oil (or olive oil for richer flavor)
recipeInstructions:
Preheat the oven to 325°F. Line an 8x8 inch baking pan with parchment paper. 
In a medium bowl, mix together granulated sugar, powdered sugar, flour, cocoa powder, chocolate chips, and salt. 
In a separate large bowl, whisk together eggs, oil, water, and vanilla extract until smooth. 
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, folding just until combined. The batter will be thick. 
Pour the batter into the prepared pan, using a spatula to spread it evenly. 
Bake for 40-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out with a few moist crumbs. 
Allow brownies to cool completely before slicing and serving. 
Store leftovers in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 1 month.

title: French Macarons
about: This easy French macaron recipe makes a batch of the most dainty, delicate, and delicious cookies. Follow these steps for a treat to impress friends and family!
recipeInstructions:
Sieve the icing sugar and ground almonds together in a large bowl and whisk together.
Whiz the dry ingredients in the food processor and then sieve again. Repeat this process two more times for a smooth top.
Whip the egg whites with the cream of tartar. Add salt and gradually add the sugar. Mix until the meringue reaches the soft peak stage.
Add vanilla and any gel food coloring at this point.
Whip the meringue to stiff peaks, ideally finishing the whisking by hand for better control.
Add a third of the confectioner’s sugar and almond mixture to the meringue and fold in gently using circular motions.
Add the remaining dry mixture and continue folding until the batter reaches a lava-like consistency.
Transfer the batter to a pastry bag fitted with a round tip. Pipe onto a sheet of parchment paper fixed to a cookie sheet.
Tap the tray several times to remove air bubbles. Let the macaron shells sit for 40-60 minutes to form a skin.
Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C). Bake for 12-15 minutes, until the shells are set and do not wobble.
Cool for 10 minutes on the pan, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Pipe filling onto the back of half the shells and form a sandwich. Enjoy your French macarons!

title: Vanilla Ice Cream
about: This classic vanilla ice cream recipe creates a smooth, creamy dessert infused with real vanilla flavor. It can be made with or without an ice cream machine.
recipeInstructions:
Put the canister from the machine into the freezer a day before you want to make the ice cream.
Pour the cream and milk into a medium heavy-based pan, then add half of the sugar.
Slit the vanilla pod down its length, scoop out the seeds, and add to the cream mixture. Cut the pod into three pieces and add to the pan.
Heat the cream and milk over low heat, stirring occasionally until it almost boils. Remove from heat and let it infuse for 30 minutes.
In a bowl, beat the egg yolks with the remaining sugar for about 2 minutes until thickened and pale.
Using a measuring jug, scoop out 125ml of the cream mixture and beat into the egg yolks to slacken them. Reheat the cream until it just comes to a boil, then stir in the egg yolk mixture.
Return the pan to low heat, stirring constantly, for 8-10 minutes until the custard coats the back of a spoon. Avoid boiling.
Pour the custard into a heatproof bowl and place it in a larger bowl one-third full of iced water to cool for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cover and refrigerate for 3-4 hours, or preferably overnight.
Get the ice cream machine running, remove the vanilla pod pieces, and slowly pour in the cold custard. Churn for 10-30 minutes until thickened.
Transfer to a plastic container, cover with cling film, then a lid, and freeze for a minimum of 3 hours.
To make it by hand: In step 1, heat the milk, vanilla, and half of the sugar without the cream. At the start of step 6, whip the cream until light and fold into the cold custard. Freeze for 3-4 hours, stirring once an hour until almost frozen, then freeze as above.

title: Classic Cheesecake
about: This classic cheesecake recipe is creamy and smooth with a buttery graham cracker crust. Perfect for any occasion.
ingredients: 1 Tablespoon brown sugar (or substitute white sugar)
32 oz cream cheese, softened to room temperature (910g)
4 large eggs, room temperature, lightly beaten
recipeInstructions:
Preheat oven to 325°F (160°C).
Combine graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and brown sugar, then stir well. Add melted butter and mix with a fork until well combined.
Pour crumbs into a 9” springform pan and press firmly into the bottom and up the sides. Set aside.
In a large bowl, add softened cream cheese and stir until smooth and creamy. Do not over-beat.
Add sugar and stir again until creamy.
Add sour cream, vanilla extract, and salt, and mix until well-combined, scraping the sides and bottom of the bowl to ensure all ingredients are incorporated.
With the mixer on low speed, gradually add lightly beaten eggs, one at a time, stirring just until each egg is incorporated. Scrape the sides and bottom of the bowl again.
Pour the cheesecake batter into the prepared springform pan. To prevent leaks, place the pan on a foil-lined cookie sheet.
Bake at 325°F (160°C) for 50-60 minutes, or until the edges are slightly puffed and just starting to turn a light golden brown. The center should spring back when touched but remain slightly jiggly.
Remove from oven and let cool on top of the oven for 10 minutes. Then, use a knife to gently loosen the crust from the inside of the springform pan.
Allow cheesecake to cool for another 1-2 hours until it reaches near room temperature. Transfer to the refrigerator and cool for at least 6 hours, or overnight.
Remove the ring of the springform pan just before serving. Enjoy!

title: Chocolate Mousse
about: This chocolate mousse is rich, creamy, and delicately airy, a perfect dessert for chocolate lovers. Garnished with whipped cream and chocolate shavings, it's an indulgent treat.
ingredients: 125g / 4.5 oz dark cooking chocolate, bittersweet / 70% cocoa
Optional: raspberries and mint sprig for garnish
recipeInstructions:
Separate eggs and yolks while eggs are cold. Place whites in a large bowl and yolks in a small bowl.
Whisk yolks until uniform.
Break chocolate into pieces and place in a microwave-safe bowl with butter. Melt in 30-second bursts, stirring between bursts, until smooth.
Beat cream until stiff peaks form. Be careful not to over-whip.
Add sugar to egg whites. Beat whites until firm peaks form.
Fold egg yolks into cream using a rubber spatula, folding 8 times maximum.
Ensure chocolate is still runny but warm. If needed, microwave in 5-second bursts until runny.
Pour chocolate into the cream-yolk mixture. Fold through in 8 folds.
Add 1/4 of the beaten egg whites into the chocolate mixture. Fold through until incorporated, aiming for 10 folds.
Pour chocolate mixture into the remaining egg whites. Fold until incorporated, with no white streaks remaining, aiming for 12 folds.
Divide mixture into 4 small glasses or pots. Refrigerate for at least 6 hours or overnight.
Garnish with whipped cream and chocolate shavings before serving. Optionally, add raspberries and a mint sprig for color.
